1.title: Episode 1
1.plot: Jeffrey takes us to the #33 garage and introduces us to the complex inner-workings of a NASCAR cup team. From the cars and all their parts to the team's family dynamic, we see what goes into making Jeffrey's racing dream a reality.

2.title: Episode 2
2.plot: We head to the race at Kentucky Speedway and follow Jeffrey from his preparations for the race, all the way through to the checkered flag. Getting the whole experience of a NASCAR race day, we also witness the struggle of a low-budget team.

3.title: Episode 3
3.plot: Jeffrey takes us around his home in rural North Carolina and we learn more about his life off the track. Diving into the family name and his desire to build a career off his own hard work, we see Jeffrey's independent spirit shine through.

4.title: Episode 4
4.plot: Regardless of how the last race went, Jeffrey and the team get home and go straight back to work. We join Jeffrey for a workout, see how the pit crew works on their pit stops, and watch how Jeffrey gets his practice laps in.

5.title: Episode 5
5.plot: There's no denying the risks that come with racing cars at 200 miles per hour. We dive into the dangers involved in the career Jeffrey has chosen to pursue, and we head to a go kart track where lots of racers get their start.

imdb.plot outline: Jeffrey Earnhardt is the grandson of seven-time Nascar Cup Champion Dale Earnhardt and nephew of his generation's most popular driver Dale Junior. Jeffrey hasn't depended on his famous last name for opportunity. He is creating his own company and working his way through the ranks like his grandfather did. The 4th generation racer is absolutely committed to "Earning Earnhardt" and has begun his journey to become a champion at the Nascar Cup Series Level. He has started at the bottom of the ranks. And there is only one way to go. Up.
imdb.title: The Driver
plot: Jeffrey Earnhardt is the grandson of seven-time Nascar Cup Champion Dale Earnhardt and nephew of his generation's most popular driver Dale Junior. Jeffrey hasn't depended on his famous last name for opportunity. He is creating his own company and working his way through the ranks like his grandfather did. The 4th generation racer is absolutely committed to "Earning Earnhardt" and has begun his journey to become a champion at the Nascar Cup Series Level. He has started at the bottom of the ranks. And there is only one way to go. Up.
